isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Assembly and Installation - Install Drive Flange and Hubcap

step1.para: Apply a layer of silicone gasket material to the hub mounting surface of the drive flange ONLY. Refer to PREPARE PARTS FOR ASSEMBLY Section.
Apply O-617-A or O-617-B wheel bearing grease (refer to LUBRICATION, INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE Section) to the inside splines of the drive flange and the splines of the driveshaft.
Install the drive flange on the hub and fasten with washers and capserews (Figure 49). Tighten the capscrews to the correct torques. Refer to Fastener Torque Chart.

figure.caption: Figure 49. Install Drive Flange on Hub

step1.para: Install the snap ring on the end of the axle shaft (Figure 50). Make sure the snap ring is positioned in the groove at the end of the axle shaft.

Apply a 0.125-inch continuous bead of silicone gasket material around either the mounting surface of the hubcap or the drive flange. Refer to Silicone (RTV) Gasket Material Application in PREPARE PARTS FOR ASSEMBLY Section. Install the hubcap and tighten the capscrews to the correct torque (Figure 51). Refer to Fastener Torque Chart.
